casebody.data:
BELLSOUTH
v.
CITY OF LAURINBURG. No. 118P05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 6, 2005. Edward S. Finley, Jr., Raleigh, Edward L. Rankin, III, Dorian S. Denburg, Atlanta, GA, John E. Muench, Robert M. Dow, Jr., Chicago, IL, for BellSouth Telecommunications. Charles L. Hicks, Jr., Laurinburg, for City of Laurinburg. Ronnie M. Mitchell, Coy E. Brewer, Jr., Fayetteville, for School Link, Inc. Karen K. Prather, M. Gray Styers, Jr., Warrenton, for Telecommunications Ind., et al. Wade H. Hargrove, Mark J. Prak, Marcus W. Trathen, Raleigh, for NC Cable Telecommunications. The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 29th day of March 2005 by Defendant (City of Laurinburg) to Strike Amicus Curiae Brief in Support of the N.C. Cable Telecommunications Association: "Motion Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference this the 6th day of April 2005." Justice MARTIN recused.
